Patent.description: Patents protect inventions that are new, inventive, and useful. They give the holder exclusive rights to make, use, or sell the invention for 20 years (subject to renewal fees). A provisional patent can secure an early filing date while you refine your concept.
next_steps: Conduct a prior-art search to confirm novelty.
Prepare a provisional patent through a registered IP attorney or CIPC e-filing.
After 12 months, file a complete or PCT application for international protection.
Maintain confidentiality until the filing date.
Patent.approx_cost: South Africa: R 2 000 – R 6 000 (provisional filing); R 25 000 – R 60 000 (full patent).

Design.description: Design protection covers the aesthetic or visual appearance of a product—its shape, pattern, or configuration—rather than its function. Registered designs in South Africa last up to 15 years.
next_steps: Prepare clear drawings or images showing the product from all angles.
File a design application at CIPC or via an IP attorney.
Keep prototypes confidential until filing to preserve novelty.
Design.approx_cost: South Africa: R 1 500 – R 4 000 (filing fee); renewal every 3–5 years.

Trademark.description: Trademarks protect distinctive names, logos, and slogans that identify goods or services. They prevent others from using confusingly similar marks and can last indefinitely with renewals every 10 years.
next_steps: Search the CIPC or WIPO database to check for similar marks.
File an application with CIPC or WIPO Madrid System for international coverage.
Use ™ before registration and ® once approved.
Trademark.approx_cost: South Africa: R 600 – R 2 000 per class; International (Madrid): R 15 000 – R 30 000 depending on countries.

Copyright.description: Copyright automatically protects original literary, artistic, and musical works once created. It does not require registration in South Africa and usually lasts for the creator’s lifetime + 50 years.
next_steps: Keep dated drafts or files as proof of authorship.
Use © Your Name (Year) to indicate ownership.
Register with voluntary services (e.g., South African Music Rights Organisation) if applicable.
Copyright.approx_cost: Automatic on creation; optional registration under R 1 000 for proof services.

Trade Secret.description: Trade secrets protect confidential business information that provides a competitive advantage. Protection lasts as long as the information remains secret.
next_steps: Use non-disclosure agreements (NDAs) with employees and partners.
Limit access and store information securely.
Document confidentiality procedures for legal evidence.
Trade Secret.approx_cost: Mostly legal drafting and security costs (R 2 000 – R 10 000 for NDAs and policy setup).
